issue.title: Remove table formatting from the Graded Browser Support document in docs>contributing

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: User requests new documentation or improvements to existing documentation

milestone.title: v5.0
milestone.description:
In this release, we will:

- Do some internal prep' work
  - [Enhance the structure of our repository](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3291)
  - [Track performance impact of our built files](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3279)
- Update our browser support, which includes
  - [Update our strategy for browser support](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2718)
  - [Update how we load JavaScript in browser](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2639)
  - [Reduce support for browsers dropped by our support strategy (especially Internet Explorer)](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2621)
  - [Implement newer techniques made available by our support strategy](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3505)
- [Clarify our JavaScript components' public API](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3478)
- [Remove compatibility mode](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2769)
- [Improve the readability and hover state of links](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2197) by enabling the new link styles introduced in v3.12.0 by default
- [Remove things deprecated as part of v4.x releases](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3524)
- [Update the design of the Tag component](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/3502)
- [Publish the Task List component](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/2261)
- [Ensure that v5 works with the Prototype Kit](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3947)

[Update and restructure documentation in Frontend and Design System sites for v4 and v5 #2186](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/issues/2186) This epic includes:
- [Update Design System site content for v5 changes #2993](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/issues/2993)
- [Define and create new content needed for v5.0.0 of GOV.UK Frontend #311](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/issues/311)
- [Create a new page highlighting v5 differences and how to migrate to v5 #315](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/issues/315)

Corresponding milestones in our other repositories capture the work specific to them:
 - [Design System](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/milestone/16)
 - [Frontend Docs](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/milestone/9)

issue.body:
<!--

  This is a template for any issues that aren’t bug reports or new feature requests. The headings in this section provide examples of the information you might want to include, but feel free to add/delete sections where appropriate.

-->

## What
Change the table formatting in the graded browser support (full version) in docs>contributing to bullet lists for each grade.
## Why
The table did not work well in a mobile format and made the information harder to read.
## Who needs to work on this
Tech writer
## Who needs to review this
Developer
## Done when

- [ ] Updates are added to the document

pull_request.title: Add CHANGELOG entry about `<script>` snippet
pull_request.body:
The snippet setting the `govuk-frontend-supported` class is described in the Frontend Docs, but not the release notes.

Addresses [feedback from #4389](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/discussions/4389#discussioncomment-7396486)

repo.description: GOV.UK Frontend contains the code you need to start building a user interface for government platforms and services.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -204,6 +204,22 @@ These changes were made in the following pull requests:
 - [#3491: Update Review app to import `govuk-frontend` via local package](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/3491)
 - [#3498: Remove built `dist` and `package` from source](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/3498)
 
+#### Update the `<script>` snippet at the top of your `<body>` tag
+
+We've introduced a new `govuk-frontend-supported` class marking that GOV.UK Frontend is supported in the browser showing the page. It complements the existing `js-enabled` class and is necessary for components to initialise.
comment.body: Probably yes to the migration page. And the suggested change looks good to me as well.

comment.body:
Very important to note that good CSP (Content Security Policy) will block inline scripts so there will very likely be a [hash to update](https://frontend.design-system.service.gov.uk/importing-css-assets-and-javascript/#use-a-hash-to-unblock-inline-javascript) in production services:

```patch
- sha256-+6WnXIl4mbFTCARd8N3COQmT3bJJmo32N8q8ZSQAIcU=
- sha256-GUQ5ad8JK5KmEWmROf3LZd9ge94daqNvd8xy9YS1iDw=
```

We'll need to put this on the migration page too?
https://release-5-0--govuk-frontend-docs-preview.netlify.app/changes-to-govuk-frontend-v5/

I'd probably state that we handle this change automatically too

Only users that implement their own page templates need to take action

```suggestion
Page templates now include a new `govuk-frontend-supported` class on the `<body>` tag when GOV.UK Frontend JavaScript components are fully supported.

If you are not using our [Nunjucks page template](https://design-system.service.gov.uk/styles/page-template/), replace the existing snippet:
```

 - [#3498: Remove built `dist` and `package` from source](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/3498)
 
+#### Update the `<script>` snippet at the top of your `<body>` tag
+
+We've introduced a new `govuk-frontend-supported` class marking that GOV.UK Frontend is supported in the browser showing the page. It complements the existing `js-enabled` class and is necessary for components to initialise.
comment.body:
It's the first one. Guess it's a sign that I should split it into two sentences, maybe?

Regarding "showing the page", I was trying to clarify "the browser" by adding that it's the one currently rendering the page (as "GOV.UK Frontend is supported in the browser" sounded a bit of a short end).

Addresses [feedback from #4389](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/discussions/4389#discussioncomment-7396486)

milestone.title: v5.0
milestone.description:
In this release, we will:

- Do some internal prep' work
  - [Enhance the structure of our repository](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3291)
  - [Track performance impact of our built files](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3279)
- Update our browser support, which includes
  - [Update our strategy for browser support](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2718)
  - [Update how we load JavaScript in browser](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2639)
  - [Reduce support for browsers dropped by our support strategy (especially Internet Explorer)](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2621)
  - [Implement newer techniques made available by our support strategy](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3505)
- [Clarify our JavaScript components' public API](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3478)
- [Remove compatibility mode](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2769)
- [Improve the readability and hover state of links](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2197) by enabling the new link styles introduced in v3.12.0 by default
- [Remove things deprecated as part of v4.x releases](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3524)
- [Update the design of the Tag component](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/3502)
- [Publish the Task List component](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/2261)
- [Ensure that v5 works with the Prototype Kit](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3947)

[Update and restructure documentation in Frontend and Design System sites for v4 and v5 #2186](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/issues/2186) This epic includes:
- [Update Design System site content for v5 changes #2993](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/issues/2993)
- [Define and create new content needed for v5.0.0 of GOV.UK Frontend #311](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/issues/311)
- [Create a new page highlighting v5 differences and how to migrate to v5 #315](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/issues/315)

Corresponding milestones in our other repositories capture the work specific to them:
 - [Design System](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/milestone/16)
 - [Frontend Docs](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/milestone/9)

pull_request.title: [DO NOT MERGE] Implement the Tudor crown favicons (v5.x)
pull_request.body:
Implements the Tudor crown for browser 'favourite' icons, homescreen icons and OpenGraph sharing graphics. Part of #4178. This follows the spike work in #4185 using the finalised set of icons and production-ready assets. > [!WARNING] > This PR should not be merged until we have approval to do so. ## Changes - Replaces icons using the St. Edward's crown with equivalents using the Tudor crown. - Renames all of the icons to be largely agnostic to their usage, instead being named for the image's dimensions. - Changes the way the ICO favicon is referenced in HTML: - Fixes a potential issue with the `sizes` attribute where Chrome would always use the ICO even when an SVG favicon was available ([`sizes` issue detailed here in section 2.3](https://dev.to/masakudamatsu/favicon-nightmare-how-to-maintain-sanity-3al7)). - Changes `rel="shortcut icon"` to `rel="icon"`. The `shortcut` keyword was only needed for supporting Internet Explorer 8 and earlier, which Frontend no longer does. - Removes `apple-touch-icon` sizes smaller than 180×180. These aren't used by Apple devices released in the last few years and lower resolution Apple devices can scale down the larger image automatically. - Redesigns the smallest icon sizes (48px and below) to use a simplified version of the Tudor crown icon. - Adds an SVG version of the favicon graphic. We've opted not to have this icon change depending on the user's dark or light mode setting. - Adds 192×192 and 512×512 PNG icons. - Inverts the design of the mask icon to be consistent with how the icon is presented elsewhere. The crown is now transparent and presented within a coloured box. - Adds a `manifest.json` file listing all of the available icon sizes and their expected uses. - Adds Jest tests for the icons and manifest file. ## Assets included |Name|Type|Dimensions|Notes| |:-|:-|-:|:-| |**Icon container**
favicon.ico|Icon container|16×16, 32×32, 48×48|Multiple PNGs bundled into a single container. All images use simplified crown design. Primarily used by Safari (iOS/iPadOS), IE and some third-parties.| |**SVG icon**
favicon.svg|SVG|variable|Uses simplified crown design. Primarily used by Chromium and Firefox.| |**iOS icon**
govuk-icon-180.png|PNG|180×180|Primarily used on the iOS/iPadOS homescreen.| |**Android icon**
govuk-icon-192.png|PNG|192×192|Primarily used on the Android homescreen.| |**Large icon**
govuk-icon-512.png|PNG|512×512|Fallback for any applications that request a larger size but cannot use SVG. May also be used by Safari 17's "Add to dock" feature on macOS.| |**Mask icon**
govuk-icon-mask.svg|SVG|variable|Uses simplified crown design. Primarily used by Safari (macOS) and MacBooks featuring the Touch Bar.| |**OpenGraph image**
govuk-opengraph-image.png|PNG|1200×630|Primarily used when sharing on third-party websites and services.| ## Screenshots All screenshots show the current St. Edward's crown icon, as used on GOV.UK, alongside the new icon introduced in this PR. ### Chrome 118, macOS 13.6 Old: Icon container New: SVG icon ### Chrome 117 (tab switcher), Android 14.0[^emulated] Old: Icon container OR iOS icon (which was used kept changing between different tests) New: Android icon ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/9a661551-ce5c-442d-89f2-b4a543c0b62f) ### Firefox 118, macOS 13.6 Old: Icon container New: SVG icon ### Safari 17.0, macOS 13.6 (separate layout) Both: Mask icon ### Safari 17.0, macOS 13.6 (compact layout) Both: Mask icon ### Safari 17.0, iOS 17.0 (tab switcher) Both: Icon container ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/d491af86-e725-4154-bdfe-228467af4ecb) ### Internet Explorer 11, Windows 10[^emulated] Both: Icon container ### macOS 14.0 dock Old: iOS icon[^macOSIcon] New: iOS icon[^macOSIcon] [^macOSIcon]: macOS seems uses whichever PNG is listed first in the manifest file, so long as that is at least 180×180. If no suitable icon is in the manifest, or the manifest file doesn't exist, the `apple-touch-icon` meta tag is used. If that is absent, it uses the icon container favicon. If none are available, a generic letter/colour-based icon is generated instead. ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/9dad5d24-8cd2-4092-baf5-b35a559be445) ### iOS 17.0 homescreen Both: iOS icon ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/593b149f-fe88-4da6-89e8-552577a68863) ### Android homescreen[^emulated] Old: iOS icon New: Android icon #### Circular icons, Android 14 (Google Pixel 8) #### Squircle icons, Android 13 (Samsung Galaxy S23) #### Rounded square icons, Android 13 (Xiaomi Redmi Note 12) [^emulated]: This screenshot was captured via a simulator or remote capturing device. It may not be displayed at the true resolution, and may appear blurrier or more pixellated than in reality.

milestone.title: v5.0
milestone.description:
In this release, we will:

- Do some internal prep' work
  - [Enhance the structure of our repository](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3291)
  - [Track performance impact of our built files](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3279)
- Update our browser support, which includes
  - [Update our strategy for browser support](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2718)
  - [Update how we load JavaScript in browser](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2639)
  - [Reduce support for browsers dropped by our support strategy (especially Internet Explorer)](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2621)
  - [Implement newer techniques made available by our support strategy](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3505)
- [Clarify our JavaScript components' public API](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3478)
- [Remove compatibility mode](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2769)
- [Improve the readability and hover state of links](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/2197) by enabling the new link styles introduced in v3.12.0 by default
- [Remove things deprecated as part of v4.x releases](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3524)
- [Update the design of the Tag component](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/3502)
- [Publish the Task List component](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/pull/2261)
- [Ensure that v5 works with the Prototype Kit](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/issues/3947)

[Update and restructure documentation in Frontend and Design System sites for v4 and v5 #2186](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/issues/2186) This epic includes:
- [Update Design System site content for v5 changes #2993](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/issues/2993)
- [Define and create new content needed for v5.0.0 of GOV.UK Frontend #311](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/issues/311)
- [Create a new page highlighting v5 differences and how to migrate to v5 #315](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/issues/315)

Corresponding milestones in our other repositories capture the work specific to them:
 - [Design System](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-design-system/milestone/16)
 - [Frontend Docs](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend-docs/milestone/9)

issue.body:
Unlike npm, yarn is not happy unless `optionalDependencies` are published

Addresses user feedback from https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/discussions/4389#discussioncomment-7401425

pull_request.title: [DO NOT MERGE] Implement the Tudor crown favicons (v5.x)
pull_request.body:
Implements the Tudor crown for browser 'favourite' icons, homescreen icons and OpenGraph sharing graphics. Part of #4178. This follows the spike work in #4185 using the finalised set of icons and production-ready assets. > [!WARNING] > This PR should not be merged until we have approval to do so. ## Changes - Replaces icons using the St. Edward's crown with equivalents using the Tudor crown. - Renames all of the icons to be largely agnostic to their usage, instead being named for the image's dimensions. - Changes the way the ICO favicon is referenced in HTML: - Fixes a potential issue with the `sizes` attribute where Chrome would always use the ICO even when an SVG favicon was available ([`sizes` issue detailed here in section 2.3](https://dev.to/masakudamatsu/favicon-nightmare-how-to-maintain-sanity-3al7)). - Changes `rel="shortcut icon"` to `rel="icon"`. The `shortcut` keyword was only needed for supporting Internet Explorer 8 and earlier, which Frontend no longer does. - Removes `apple-touch-icon` sizes smaller than 180×180. These aren't used by Apple devices released in the last few years and lower resolution Apple devices can scale down the larger image automatically. - Redesigns the smallest icon sizes (48px and below) to use a simplified version of the Tudor crown icon. - Adds an SVG version of the favicon graphic. We've opted not to have this icon change depending on the user's dark or light mode setting. - Adds 192×192 and 512×512 PNG icons. - Inverts the design of the mask icon to be consistent with how the icon is presented elsewhere. The crown is now transparent and presented within a coloured box. - Adds a `manifest.json` file listing all of the available icon sizes and their expected uses. - Adds Jest tests for the icons and manifest file. ## Assets included |Name|Type|Dimensions|Notes| |:-|:-|-:|:-| |**Icon container**
favicon.ico|Icon container|16×16, 32×32, 48×48|Multiple PNGs bundled into a single container. All images use simplified crown design. Primarily used by Safari (iOS/iPadOS), IE and some third-parties.| |**SVG icon**
favicon.svg|SVG|variable|Uses simplified crown design. Primarily used by Chromium and Firefox.| |**iOS icon**
govuk-icon-180.png|PNG|180×180|Primarily used on the iOS/iPadOS homescreen.| |**Android icon**
govuk-icon-192.png|PNG|192×192|Primarily used on the Android homescreen.| |**Large icon**
govuk-icon-512.png|PNG|512×512|Fallback for any applications that request a larger size but cannot use SVG. May also be used by Safari 17's "Add to dock" feature on macOS.| |**Mask icon**
govuk-icon-mask.svg|SVG|variable|Uses simplified crown design. Primarily used by Safari (macOS) and MacBooks featuring the Touch Bar.| |**OpenGraph image**
govuk-opengraph-image.png|PNG|1200×630|Primarily used when sharing on third-party websites and services.| ## Screenshots All screenshots show the current St. Edward's crown icon, as used on GOV.UK, alongside the new icon introduced in this PR. ### Chrome 118, macOS 13.6 Old: Icon container New: SVG icon ### Chrome 117 (tab switcher), Android 14.0[^emulated] Old: Icon container OR iOS icon (which was used kept changing between different tests) New: Android icon ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/9a661551-ce5c-442d-89f2-b4a543c0b62f) ### Firefox 118, macOS 13.6 Old: Icon container New: SVG icon ### Safari 17.0, macOS 13.6 (separate layout) Both: Mask icon ### Safari 17.0, macOS 13.6 (compact layout) Both: Mask icon ### Safari 17.0, iOS 17.0 (tab switcher) Both: Icon container ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/d491af86-e725-4154-bdfe-228467af4ecb) ### Internet Explorer 11, Windows 10[^emulated] Both: Icon container ### macOS 14.0 dock Old: iOS icon[^macOSIcon] New: iOS icon[^macOSIcon] [^macOSIcon]: macOS seems uses whichever PNG is listed first in the manifest file, so long as that is at least 180×180. If no suitable icon is in the manifest, or the manifest file doesn't exist, the `apple-touch-icon` meta tag is used. If that is absent, it uses the icon container favicon. If none are available, a generic letter/colour-based icon is generated instead. ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/9dad5d24-8cd2-4092-baf5-b35a559be445) ### iOS 17.0 homescreen Both: iOS icon ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/593b149f-fe88-4da6-89e8-552577a68863) ### Android homescreen[^emulated] Old: iOS icon New: Android icon #### Circular icons, Android 14 (Google Pixel 8) #### Squircle icons, Android 13 (Samsung Galaxy S23) #### Rounded square icons, Android 13 (Xiaomi Redmi Note 12) [^emulated]: This screenshot was captured via a simulator or remote capturing device. It may not be displayed at the true resolution, and may appear blurrier or more pixellated than in reality.

comment.body:
The .ico file includes 16×16 and 32×32 sizes bundled within it. You can see all of the sizes if you download the .ico and open it in macOS's Preview app. 

Only the `sizes` attribute only lists 48×48 to avoid [the Chrome bug described in section 2.3 of this article](https://dev.to/masakudamatsu/favicon-nightmare-how-to-maintain-sanity-3al7). In testing, other browsers that use the .ico file (principally IE and Safari) seem to ignore the `sizes` attribute anyway.

Implements the Tudor crown for browser 'favourite' icons, homescreen icons and OpenGraph sharing graphics. Part of #4178. This follows the spike work in #4185 using the finalised set of icons and production-ready assets. > [!WARNING] > This PR should not be merged until we have approval to do so. ## Changes - Replaces icons using the St. Edward's crown with equivalents using the Tudor crown. - Renames all of the icons to be largely agnostic to their usage, instead being named for the image's dimensions. - Changes the way the ICO favicon is referenced in HTML: - Fixes a potential issue with the `sizes` attribute where Chrome would always use the ICO even when an SVG favicon was available ([`sizes` issue detailed here in section 2.3](https://dev.to/masakudamatsu/favicon-nightmare-how-to-maintain-sanity-3al7)). - Changes `rel="shortcut icon"` to `rel="icon"`. The `shortcut` keyword was only needed for supporting Internet Explorer 8 and earlier, which Frontend no longer does. - Removes `apple-touch-icon` sizes smaller than 180×180. These aren't used by Apple devices released in the last few years and lower resolution Apple devices can scale down the larger image automatically. - Redesigns the smallest icon sizes (48px and below) to use a simplified version of the Tudor crown icon. - Adds an SVG version of the favicon graphic. We've opted not to have this icon change depending on the user's dark or light mode setting. - Adds 192×192 and 512×512 PNG icons. - Inverts the design of the mask icon to be consistent with how the icon is presented elsewhere. The crown is now transparent and presented within a coloured box. - Adds a `manifest.json` file listing all of the available icon sizes and their expected uses. - Adds Jest tests for the icons and manifest file. ## Assets included |Name|Type|Dimensions|Notes| |:-|:-|-:|:-| |**Icon container**
favicon.ico|Icon container|16×16, 32×32, 48×48|Multiple PNGs bundled into a single container. All images use simplified crown design. Primarily used by Safari (iOS/iPadOS), IE and some third-parties.| |**SVG icon**
favicon.svg|SVG|variable|Uses simplified crown design. Primarily used by Chromium and Firefox.| |**iOS icon**
govuk-icon-180.png|PNG|180×180|Primarily used on the iOS/iPadOS homescreen.| |**Android icon**
govuk-icon-192.png|PNG|192×192|Primarily used on the Android homescreen.| |**Large icon**
govuk-icon-512.png|PNG|512×512|Fallback for any applications that request a larger size but cannot use SVG. May also be used by Safari 17's "Add to dock" feature on macOS.| |**Mask icon**
govuk-icon-mask.svg|SVG|variable|Uses simplified crown design. Primarily used by Safari (macOS) and MacBooks featuring the Touch Bar.| |**OpenGraph image**
govuk-opengraph-image.png|PNG|1200×630|Primarily used when sharing on third-party websites and services.| ## Screenshots All screenshots show the current St. Edward's crown icon, as used on GOV.UK, alongside the new icon introduced in this PR. ### Chrome 118, macOS 13.6 Old: Icon container New: SVG icon ### Chrome 117 (tab switcher), Android 14.0[^emulated] Old: Icon container OR iOS icon (which was used kept changing between different tests) New: Android icon ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/9a661551-ce5c-442d-89f2-b4a543c0b62f) ### Firefox 118, macOS 13.6 Old: Icon container New: SVG icon ### Safari 17.0, macOS 13.6 (separate layout) Both: Mask icon ### Safari 17.0, macOS 13.6 (compact layout) Both: Mask icon ### Safari 17.0, iOS 17.0 (tab switcher) Both: Icon container ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/d491af86-e725-4154-bdfe-228467af4ecb) ### Internet Explorer 11, Windows 10[^emulated] Both: Icon container ### macOS 14.0 dock Old: iOS icon[^macOSIcon] New: iOS icon[^macOSIcon] [^macOSIcon]: macOS seems uses whichever PNG is listed first in the manifest file, so long as that is at least 180×180. If no suitable icon is in the manifest, or the manifest file doesn't exist, the `apple-touch-icon` meta tag is used. If that is absent, it uses the icon container favicon. If none are available, a generic letter/colour-based icon is generated instead. ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/9dad5d24-8cd2-4092-baf5-b35a559be445) ### iOS 17.0 homescreen Both: iOS icon ![](https://github.com/alphagov/govuk-frontend/assets/1253214/593b149f-fe88-4da6-89e8-552577a68863) ### Android homescreen[^emulated] Old: iOS icon New: Android icon #### Circular icons, Android 14 (Google Pixel 8) #### Squircle icons, Android 13 (Samsung Galaxy S23) #### Rounded square icons, Android 13 (Xiaomi Redmi Note 12) [^emulated]: This screenshot was captured via a simulator or remote capturing device. It may not be displayed at the true resolution, and may appear blurrier or more pixellated than in reality.
